_header: Jesu seeing peoples coming him till
_description: A paraphrase of the Beatitudes — thirteen couplets

BLHar1706.First Lines: Ihesu seynge peplys comynge hym tylleHe styed and sette hym on a hylle…
BLHar1706.Last Lines: …Ioye ye and glad ye wiþ mylde steueneYour mede ys moche in blye of heuene
BLHar1706.Note: Arabic numbers for each beatitude written in rubric in outer margins.
BLHar1706.Attributed Title: Octo beatitudines (rubric, above first line, f. 208v)
BLHar1706.Facsimiles:
Digital Facsimile of British Library Harley MS 1706.

BLHar1706.Editions:
Hirsh,  John C. 
             “Prayer and Meditation in Late Mediaeval England: MS. Bodley
                789.” 
             Medium Ævum
         48 (1979): 55-66: 64.

Ushaw28.First Lines:
Ihesus seyng peples comyng him tillehe steyd and set him on an
                    hille…
Ushaw28.Last Lines:
…blesside be pore men milde in spirithþe rewme of heuen
                    is here be Ryghte……þis lesson a virtuose chylde shulde
                    seyoften to his souereyns eueryday
Ushaw28.Note:
Two couplets of introduction, nine Beatitudes, and four-line conclusion
                    in Speculum Christiani, Quarta Tabula
